channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: No parking available due to a mix of commercial vans and non residents parking in the road, 3rd December
item.description:
On Thorpewood Avenue (SE26) we have a growing issue with commercial vans being left on the road for several days at a time without moving. Some vehicles remain parked for two to four days continuously. This is creating a number of problems for the street. Residents are finding it increasingly difficult to park near their homes because these long stay vans take up valuable space for extended periods. Large vans restrict visibility for children and families walking to and from school and make it harder for prams, pushchairs and wheelchairs to navigate the road safely. The size and positioning of the vans narrow the road, making passing traffic more difficult and sometimes forcing oncoming cars to reverse long distances. The street is effectively being used as a storage area for commercial vehicles that do not belong to residents, and this has become a daily issue. The current school related restrictions do not prevent these vans from occupying the street outside the restricted hours and the situation has noticeably worsened in recent months. We request that the council investigates this matter and considers introducing appropriate parking controls or reviewing the existing restrictions. This part of the road is increasingly being used for unmanaged long stay commercial parking, and it is having a serious impact on residents and on safety around school times. Photos can be provided if required. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Thorpewood Avenue, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Worsening road condition damaging buildings cracks appearing, 3rd December
item.description:
Please fix the road surface on Forest Hill Road outside of Forest Hill Supermarket up towards Therapia Road. The 16 Tonne buses are sending ripples of low frequency vibrations. Cracks are forming in people’s homes and it’s impossible to relax. so many of the residents deserve to have their voice heard on this issue which is getting much worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 118, Forest Hill Road, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very overgrown weeds, 3rd December
item.description:
Please can you remove the weeds all along the grass verge along Evergreen Close. They haven’t been cut for months and just grow back really quickly. Can something be done to remove them completely please and return the verge to grass (or even better - flowers!!) The tall weeds attract litter dumping and fly tipping as well as endless dog fouling. Children live in this close and have to walk along the verge to safely get to their houses. Please take action!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evergreen Close, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole prior to Paddington turnoff on the Westway, 3rd December
item.description:
Large pothole prior to Paddington turn off on the Westway heading east, middle lane I think. Highly dangerous if a motorcycle hits it at night. I noticed a second large pothole after the Paddington turnoff again on the Westway, equally as dangerous for motorcycles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westway, Bayswater, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet
